abstract: Arizona Gov Doug Ducey vetoes bill that would have stopped law enforcement agencies from releasing names of police officers involved in serious or fatal shootings for 60 days; Ducey expresses understanding of bill's intent to protect police officers but says it could limit transparency and increase public's distrust of law enforcement.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Doug Ducey vetoed legislation that would have prevented law enforcement agencies from releasing the names of officers involved in serious or fatal shootings for 60 days.

headline.main: Arizona Governor Vetoes Bill to Shield Police Names
headline.print_headline: Bill to Shield Police Names Is Vetoed in Arizona

snippet: Gov. Doug Ducey vetoed legislation that would have prevented law enforcement agencies from releasing the names of officers involved in serious or fatal shootings for 60 days.
